subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 18, 2007

TOP STORIESMassive Global Pedophile Ring Busted
Authorities in the United Kingdom say they've smashed a huge international Internet pedophile ring, rounding up more than
                        700 suspects and rescuing 31 children from sexual exploitation. The 10 month investigation involved agencies from 35 countries.
                         More...Watch: Pedophile Ring Busted
• Will Fed Trial Put "Hit" On Chicago Mob?• West Rallies To Aid West Bank Palestinians
                     					| Watch• 36 Killed In Fierce Iraq Clashes
                     					| WatchU.S.Will Fed Trial Put "Hit" On Chicago Mob?
Experts say a trial commencing this week stemming from the FBI's "Operation Family Secrets" investigation into the Outfit,
                        Chicago's organized crime family, could be one of the most significant ever in the government's war against the mob.  More...
• Thousands Of Pearls Found In Shipwreck• Pregnant Mother Goes Missing In Ohio
                     					| Watch• Pa. Teen Charged In Triple Murder• More StoriesWorldWest Rallies To Aid West Bank Palestinians
The EU is restoring millions in aid to the emergency government that Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas installed after Hamas
                        took control of Gaza. The U.S. and Israel also prepare to lift economic sanctions. But a humanitarian crisis looms in Gaza. More...Watch: Gaza Refugee Crisis
• 36 Killed In Fierce Iraq Clashes
                     					| Watch• Fighting Resumes At Lebanon Refugee Camps• U.S. Air Strike Kills 7 Afghan Kids
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsMcConnell: Immigration Too Close To Call
The Senate's top Republican said he could not predict whether the stalled immigration reform bill will pass, citing questions
                        among conservatives as to whether it guarantees amnesty to illegal immigrants. More...Watch: Face The Nation, 06.17.07
• Agreed: Something Needs To Change In Iraq
                     					| Watch• President Bush And The National Debt• Romney Surges Ahead In Bellwether States
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthA Pill To Forget?
Many of us would pay top dollar for a pill that would enhance our ability to remember. But Lesley Stahl found a scientist
                        who is far more excited about a pill that promises to do exactly the opposite. More...Watch: The Memory Pill
• A Lyme Disease Warning From The CDC
                     					| Watch• Is America Too Sweet On Sugar?• Weight Loss Surgery Safer For Teens?• More StoriesSciTechCrew Set To Test Space Station Computers
Russian controllers want to make sure the space station's revived computers can keep station stable so the space shuttle Atlantis
                        can depart Tuesday. Atlantis has been keeping the station in its proper orbit since the computers crashed last week. More...
• Wireless Technology Takes A Leap Forward• Massive Global Pedophile Ring Busted
                     					| Watch• Blu-Ray Scores A Coup In Format War• More StoriesBusinessAirbus Makes A Splash With US Airways
Airbus made a splash at the Paris Air Show with the announcement that US Airways will replace its fleet of Boeing 737s with
                        Airbus craft, and will be the first North American carrier to launch Airbus' new extra-widebody A350 model. More...
• Blu-Ray Scores A Coup In Format War• eBay At Middle Age• Wireless Technology Takes A Leap Forward• More StoriesEntertainmentA Weekend Of Visitors For Paris
Kathy and Rick Hilton visited their daughter in jail on Sunday, which was Father's Day. And Paris' sister, Nicky, dropped
                        by on Saturday. More...Watch: An Idea For Ms. Hilton
• Fans Flock To This Year's Bonnaroo• Ex-Beatle To Sell Solo Songs Online• The ShowBuzz Weekly Forecast• More StoriesOpinionAndy's Personality Quiz
Ever wonder if you are a Type A or Type B personality? You could take a test from a magazine or consult your horoscope in
                        the paper. Or you could take Andy Rooney's quiz. More...Watch: Type A, Type B Personalities
• Maybe There Should Be A Third Party
                     					| Watch• Hands Off S-CHIP!
                     					| Watch• Tet All Over Again
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Pregnant Mother Goes Missing In Ohio
Jessie Mudle Davis, who is nine months pregnant, was last heard from June 13. She spoke to her mother on the phone, but after
                        that, Davis, who has a 2-year-old son, vanished. More...Watch: Pregnant Woman Missing

Plane Lands Without GearCBS News RAW:  A small passenger plane carrying 17 people in New Zealand made an emergency landing on its belly after
                                    its landing gear failed to deploy.
